intro: Lomaria nuda, commonly known as the naked lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. Lomaria nuda is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
